snippet: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo said the investigative commission, which he formed last July, was no longer necessary because of reforms he had persuaded lawmakers to support.
abstract: New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo says he intends to dismantle Commission to Investigate Public Corruption, panel formed in July 2013 with mandate to restore public trust in government; says the reforms he wanted will be accomplished by new laws that he had persuaded legislative leaders to support; government watchdogs, and some lawmakers, disagree.

byline.original: By JESSE McKINLEY and THOMAS KAPLAN

lead_paragraph: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo said the investigative commission, which he formed last July, was no longer necessary because of reforms he had persuaded lawmakers to support.

headline.seo: Cuomo’s Push to End Moreland Commission Draws Backlash
headline.main: Capitol Corruption Panel’s Demise Angers Watchdogs
headline.print_headline: Capitol Corruption Panel’s Demise Angers Watchdogs

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Moreland Commission to Investigate Public Corruption (NYS)
